canonical_explanation.text: 3D (three-dimensional) shapes are solid shapes that have length, width, and height. They take up space. The basic 3D shapes are cube, cuboid, cylinder, sphere, and cone. A cube has 6 equal square faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices (corners). A cuboid has 6 rectangular faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices. A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces and 1 curved surface. A sphere is perfectly round like a ball with no flat faces. A cone has 1 flat circular face and 1 curved surface coming to a point. Some 3D shapes can roll (sphere, cylinder, cone) and some can slide (cube, cuboid).
rules: A cube has 6 square faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices.
A cuboid has 6 rectangular faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices.
A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces and 1 curved surface.
A sphere has no flat face — it is completely round.
A cone has 1 flat circular face and 1 curved surface that comes to a point (apex).
Shapes that are round can roll (sphere, cylinder, cone).
Shapes with flat faces can slide on a flat surface (cube, cuboid).
3D shapes are found in everyday objects around us.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape is perfectly round like a ball?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere is perfectly round, like a ball.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere has no flat surface and is round everywhere — just like a ball.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has 6 square faces that are all equal?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 equal square faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube is like a dice — all 6 faces are equal squares.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape looks like a box?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid looks like a box. It has 6 rectangular faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A box shape is called a cuboid. It has 6 faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has a circular base and comes to a point at the top?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has a flat circular base and narrows to a point (apex) at the top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has one circular face at the bottom and a pointed top, like an ice cream cone.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has 2 flat circular faces and a curved surface?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces (top and bottom) and 1 curved surface in the middle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder looks like a tin can — two circles on top and bottom, with a curved surface around it.

questions.question_text: How many faces does a cube have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 faces — top, bottom, front, back, left, right.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 6 square faces. Think of a dice — it has 6 sides.

questions.question_text: How many edges does a cube have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 12 edges.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 12 edges — the lines where two faces meet.

questions.question_text: How many vertices (corners) does a cube have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 8 vertices (corners).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 8 vertices — the points where edges meet.

questions.question_text: How many flat faces does a sphere have?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere has 0 flat faces. It is completely curved.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is round everywhere — it has no flat faces at all.

questions.question_text: How many flat faces does a cone have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has 1 flat face — the circular base at the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has 1 flat circular face at the base and 1 curved surface going up to the point.

questions.question_text: A ball is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A ball is round — it is shaped like a sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A ball is perfectly round, which makes it a sphere.

questions.question_text: A dice is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A dice has 6 equal square faces — it is shaped like a cube.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A dice is a cube. Each of its 6 faces shows a different number.

questions.question_text: A tin can is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A tin can has two circular faces and a curved surface — it is shaped like a cylinder.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A tin can is cylindrical — round at top and bottom with a curved surface.

questions.question_text: An ice cream cone is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: An ice cream cone is cone-shaped — it has a circular opening and narrows to a point at the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An ice cream cone is shaped like a cone — wide at the top and pointed at the bottom.

questions.question_text: A brick is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A brick has 6 rectangular faces — it is shaped like a cuboid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A brick is box-shaped with 6 rectangular faces, making it a cuboid.

questions.question_text: True or False: A sphere has no flat faces.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A sphere is completely curved and has no flat faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is round everywhere — it has 0 flat faces.

questions.question_text: True or False: A cuboid has 6 faces.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A cuboid has 6 faces — all rectangular.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid has 6 rectangular faces: top, bottom, front, back, left, and right.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape can roll in any direction?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere can roll in any direction because it is round everywhere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is perfectly round on all sides, so it can roll in any direction. A cylinder rolls in one direction. A cone rolls in a circle.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shapes can slide but NOT roll on a flat surface?
questions.explanation_correct: Cube and cuboid have only flat faces, so they can slide but cannot roll.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Shapes with flat faces (cube, cuboid) can slide. Shapes with curved surfaces (sphere, cylinder, cone) can roll.

questions.question_text: A birthday cap (party hat) is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A birthday party hat is cone-shaped — wide at the bottom and pointed at the top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A party hat narrows from a circular base to a point at the top, making it a cone.

questions.question_text: A cricket ball is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A cricket ball is round — it is shaped like a sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cricket ball is perfectly round, making it a sphere.

questions.question_text: How many flat faces does a cylinder have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces — one on top and one on the bottom.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces (top and bottom) and 1 curved surface.

questions.question_text: How many edges does a cuboid have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid has 12 edges, just like a cube.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid has 12 edges — the lines where two rectangular faces meet.

questions.question_text: How many vertices does a cuboid have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid has 8 vertices (corners), just like a cube.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid has 8 vertices — the points where edges meet.

questions.question_text: Which of these shapes does NOT have a curved surface?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has only flat faces and no curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sphere, cylinder, and cone all have curved surfaces. A cube has only 6 flat square faces.

questions.question_text: A water pipe is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A water pipe is long and round — shaped like a cylinder.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pipe has a round cross-section and is long, making it cylindrical.

questions.question_text: A Rubik's cube is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A Rubik's cube has 6 equal square faces — it is shaped like a cube.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A Rubik's cube has 6 equal square faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices — a perfect cube.

questions.question_text: True or False: A cylinder can both roll and slide.
questions.explanation_correct: True. A cylinder can roll (on its curved surface) and slide (on its flat faces).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has both flat faces and a curved surface, so it can roll and slide.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: A cube has ___ faces.
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 6 square faces.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: A football is shaped like a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A football is round — shaped like a sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A football is round, so it is shaped like a sphere.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has exactly 1 flat face and 1 curved surface?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has 1 flat circular face (base) and 1 curved surface going to the point.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone: 1 flat face + 1 curved surface. A cylinder has 2 flat faces. A sphere has 0 flat faces.

questions.question_text: Which shape has more faces — a cube or a cone?

options.text: Both have the same number of faces

questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 6 faces. A cone has 1 flat face. 6 > 1, so the cube has more.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cube: 6 flat faces. Cone: 1 flat face. The cube has many more faces.

questions.question_text: Which of these objects is NOT shaped like a cylinder?
questions.explanation_correct: A book is box-shaped (cuboid), not cylindrical. A glass, candle, and pipe are all cylindrical.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A glass, candle, and pipe are all round and shaped like cylinders. A book has flat rectangular faces — it is a cuboid.

questions.question_text: How is a cube different from a cuboid?

options.text: A cube has 6 faces but a cuboid has 4 faces
A cube has all square faces; a cuboid has rectangular faces
A cube can roll but a cuboid cannot
A cube has corners but a cuboid does not

questions.explanation_correct: A cube has all 6 faces as equal squares. A cuboid has 6 faces that are rectangles (not all equal).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both have 6 faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices. The difference is: cube faces are all equal squares; cuboid faces are rectangles.

questions.question_text: Which of these 3D shapes has NO edges and NO vertices?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere has no edges and no vertices — it is completely smooth and round.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is perfectly round with no flat faces, no edges, and no vertices.

questions.question_text: Aarav counted the vertices of a shape and found 8. The shape could be:
questions.explanation_correct: Both a cube and a cuboid have 8 vertices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cube: 8 vertices. Cuboid: 8 vertices. Sphere: 0. Cone: 1 (the apex). Cylinder: 0.

questions.question_text: A joker's hat is shaped like a cone. How many pointed ends does it have?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has 1 pointed end (the apex) at the top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone narrows to just 1 point called the apex.

questions.question_text: True or False: A cube and a cuboid both have 12 edges.
questions.explanation_correct: True. Both a cube and a cuboid have 12 edges.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both cube and cuboid have 6 faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices.

questions.question_text: True or False: A cone has 2 flat faces.
questions.explanation_correct: False. A cone has only 1 flat face (the circular base). The other surface is curved.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has 1 flat circular base and 1 curved surface. It does not have 2 flat faces.

questions.question_text: Meera stacked building blocks. Each block is the same size with 6 equal square faces. What shape is each block?
questions.explanation_correct: A block with 6 equal square faces is a cube.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 6 equal square faces = cube. If the faces were rectangles of different sizes, it would be a cuboid.

questions.question_text: Which shape would you choose to make a wheel?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder is round and can roll — perfect for a wheel shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A wheel needs to roll, and a cylinder has a round curved surface ideal for rolling.

questions.question_text: A dosa (rolled up) looks most like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A rolled-up dosa has a cone-like shape — wide at one end and narrow at the other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rolled dosa narrows at one end, like a cone shape.

questions.question_text: Which of these has the most edges?
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 12 edges — the most of all the shapes listed.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cube: 12 edges. Cylinder: 2 circular edges. Cone: 1 circular edge. Sphere: 0 edges.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: A shape that has 6 rectangular faces and looks like a box is called a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A box shape with 6 rectangular faces is called a cuboid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid is box-shaped with 6 rectangular faces. A cube has 6 equal square faces.

questions.question_text: A globe is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A globe is round — it is shaped like a sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A globe is a model of the Earth. It is round, so its shape is a sphere.

questions.question_text: A matchbox is shaped like a:
questions.explanation_correct: A matchbox has 6 rectangular faces — it is shaped like a cuboid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A matchbox is a small box shape — that is a cuboid.

questions.question_text: Which 3D shape has both flat and curved surfaces?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder has 2 flat circular faces and 1 curved surface — it has both types.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder has flat faces (top and bottom circles) and a curved surface (the side). A cone also has both.

questions.question_text: Fill in the blank: A cube has ___ vertices.
questions.explanation_correct: A cube has 8 vertices (corners).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube has 8 vertices — the pointed corners where edges meet.

questions.question_text: Which of these real objects is shaped like a cuboid?
questions.explanation_correct: A lunch box is box-shaped with 6 rectangular faces — it is a cuboid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A lunch box is box-shaped (cuboid). A cricket ball and marble are spheres. A pencil is like a cylinder.

questions.question_text: Which statement about 3D shapes is TRUE?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid has 8 vertices. This is the only correct statement.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A: Sphere has 0 flat faces. B: Cone has 1 flat face. C: Cube has 12 edges. D: Cuboid has 8 vertices — this is correct.
